basic_infos.about_me: I'm a developer who is trying himself in various roles. I thoroughly enjoy to be a part of new projects, suggesting new ideas and implement them. I like to work in a cheerful environment, however, it is important for me to have some space where I can focus on my tasks. If you see a camera in my hand, don’t panic, it is my guilty pleasure. Photography helps me to maintain my creative side by capturing and presenting unique moments in life.

experiences.description: Development, maintenance and customization of our navigation software for our customers (Java, C++, X-Script).|In the past couple of years I have become one of the key members of our SDK and API development team. I have prepared more than 90% of the Android SDK and its sample app. As an extension of our documentation this app is a guide on how to use our SDK.

This has been probably the most gratifying period of my career so far. As a member of an innovation team I worked on a new generation of our car infotainment system. We prepared the UX/UI design front-end, back-end and embedded development.

I have gained experience in the development of the iGO front-end. How to use our custom UIML markup language and how to give soul to the layout with Lua script. I was fortunate to work on many interesting projects of our customers like SAIC Motors, Pioneer or Ferrari.

At LOGIPIX I worked on Windows application development (in Delphi) for security cameras, traffic and parking observation system. This application enables the end user to handle and supervise camera images and NVR system.
